H0.text: The 'Master Cutler' was a regular train service from Sheffield to which London Mainline rail terminus. King's Cross

H1.text: The 'Master Cutler' was a regular train service from Sheffield to which London Mainline rail terminus. Euston

H2.text: The 'Master Cutler' was a regular train service from Sheffield to which London Mainline rail terminus. St Pancras

H3.text: The 'Master Cutler' was a regular train service from Sheffield to which London Mainline rail terminus. Pangratios

A4.text: The Master Cutler is a British named express passenger train operated by East Midlands Railway between Sheffield and London St Pancras.

A5.text: In 1958, passenger services on the former Great Central route were beginning to be run down, and on 15 September of that year the title of the train switched to a new Class 40 diesel hauled service from Sheffield Victoria to London King's Cross calling at Retford only via East Coast Main Line.

A6.text: The Master Cutler to Sheffield (transferred from King's Cross in 1966, which itself had transferred from Marylebone eight years earlier).

A7.text: The principal operator is East Midlands Railway (EMR), which operates four InterCity trains every hour from London St Pancras, with two trains per hour to both Nottingham and Sheffield.

A8.text: The Midland Main Line (MML) is a major railway line between London St Pancras and Sheffield, via Leicester, Derby and Chesterfield; a spur of the line terminates at Nottingham.
